params.index: The index of the pong in the user's history.

returns._0: The Pong struct at the specified index. Requirements: - Index must be within bounds of the user's pong history.
The number of pongs tagged by the user.
An array of Pong structs in the specified range. Requirements: - Range must be valid and within bounds of the user's pong history.
True if the pong exists, false otherwise.

params.pongHash: The hash of the pong (as computed by _computeHash).

returns._0: True if the pong exists, false otherwise.

params.tag: The tag string (max 256 bytes). Emits a {LocationTagged} event. Requirements: - Tag must not exceed MAX_TAG_LENGTH. - The same location/tag cannot be tagged twice by the same user at the same timestamp.

params.sig: The signature over the tag data. Emits a {LocationTagged} event. Requirements: - Tag must not exceed MAX_TAG_LENGTH. - Signature must be valid and match the signer. - The same location/tag cannot be tagged twice by the same user at the same timestamp.
params.signer: The address of the user who signed the tag.
params.timestamp: The timestamp provided by the signer.

params.tags: Array of tag strings. Emits a {LocationTagged} event for each tag. Requirements: - All arrays must be the same length and not exceed MAX_BATCH_SIZE. - Each tag must not exceed MAX_TAG_LENGTH. - No duplicate pongs in the batch.

params.sig: The signature over the batch data. Emits a {LocationTagged} event for each tag. Requirements: - All arrays must be the same length and not exceed MAX_BATCH_SIZE. - Each tag must not exceed MAX_TAG_LENGTH. - Signature must be valid and match the signer. - No duplicate pongs in the batch.
params.signer: The address of the user who signed the tag batch.
params.timestamps: Array of timestamps provided by the signer.

getUserPong(address,uint256).notice: Returns a specific pong (location tag) for a user by index.

getUserPongCount(address).notice: Returns the number of pongs (location tags) for a user.

getUserPongsInRange(address,uint256,uint.notice: Returns a range of pongs (location tags) for a user.

hasPong(address,int32,int32,uint64,strin.notice: Checks if a pong (location tag) exists for a given user and tag data.

hasPongHash(bytes32).notice: Checks if a pong exists by its hash.

tagLocation(int32,int32,string).notice: Tag a single location with a string tag.

tagLocationWithSig(int32,int32,uint64,st.notice: Tag a location on behalf of another user, using their signature.

tagManyLocations(int32[],int32[],string[.notice: Tag multiple locations in a single transaction.

tagManyLocationsWithSig(int32[],int32[],.notice: Tag multiple locations on behalf of another user, using their signature.
